intro: Stoebe phyllostachya, commonly known as narrowleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight fragrance, which can be detected when crushed. Stoebe phyllostachya is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils.
